title: MicroservicesDeploymentServiceInstancePerVM - Q0001
text: What does the 'Service Instance per VM' deployment pattern describe?

options.text: Running one service instance per virtual machine
Running multiple services on a single VM

explanation: The pattern describes deploying one service instance per virtual machine to ensure isolation and manageability.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentServiceInstancePerVM - Q0002
text: Which of the following is a key advantage of this pattern?
explanation: Each service instance runs in its own VM, providing strong isolation and fault containment.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentServiceInstancePerVM - Q0003
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of this pattern?

options.text: High resource overhead due to multiple OS instances

explanation: Each VM runs its own OS, leading to higher memory and CPU overhead compared to containers.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentServiceInstancePerVM - Q0004
text: Which of the following technologies is commonly used for this pattern?
explanation: Virtualization technologies like VMware or KVM are used to create and manage VMs for this pattern.

explanation: Each VM is isolated, so a failure in one service instance does not impact others.
